summary: Email correspondence regarding scheduling and access information for an upcoming court hearing in the Epstein case, including details about separate public and victim dial-in lines.

events.title: Upcoming Court Hearing
events.description: A court hearing is scheduled for the day after this email exchange, with arrangements made for public and victim access via separate telephone dial-in lines.

keyFacts: A scheduling order for a court hearing was issued on April 19, 2021, attached to the email.
The hearing provided public access via a telephone dial-in line, but no video was available.
A separate, confidential telephone access line was established for victims who wished to attend the hearing.
The email sender offered to notify the court if the recipient planned to dial in, in order to provide the victim access line information.
